alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued January 10 at 4:52PM MST until January 11 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE NORTHEAST PLAINS, EAST CENTRAL PLAINS AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO VERY STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Winds will diminish this evening for a few hours, allowing existing critical fire weather conditions to wane. However, strong to damaging winds will hit much of eastern New Mexico Wednesday and will combine with low humidity to bring more widespread critical conditions to the Central Highlands, Northeast Plains and East Central Plains. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains and Central Highlands from Wednesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 35 to 45 mph with gusts to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from about 13 to 19 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
